summary:
Specialist- Customer Success Partner Expert HXM (S-CSP-HXM)
Highly motivated and passionate HR professional with more than 20 years of HR experience. Some key words describing me: customer focus, result-oriented, collaborative, pro-active, relationship manager, strong communication and organizational skills, always learn & grow and support others to learn & grow.  Supporting key customers across the EMEA North region (especially Netherlands and Nordics) in their digital transformation and to get maximum benefit/realize value from their investment in the SAP SuccessFactors solution.

Championing Diversity and Inclusion by being the Global BWN Onboarding and Membership Director and and Chapter Lead of the Business Women Network Chapter in NL. Supporting others to learn & grow as (certified) coach, mentor and buddy.

Prior to this I worked more than 16 years as Sr HR Business Partner at SAP in all client areas as Sales, Marketing, Consulting, Education and Support on all HR processes.
Earned a Bachelor at Breda University of Applied Sciences in Tourism and Leisure and Masters of Human Resources Studies at Tilburg University. 
Spare time: love skiing, pilates, travelling, cooking and meet with family and friends.

profile_positions.description:
As Customer Engagement Expert I work for SuccessFactors in EMEA, mainly for key customers in the Netherlands and the Nordics. My main tasks and responsibilities:
- work on customer success, consumption and adoption of our SAP Cloud HCM solution: SuccessFactors
- build relationships with my customers to understand their business and strategic HR goals,
ensuring alignment on service delivery, ongoing value realization and what means success to them
- responsible during the whole customer lifecycle; from onboarding of new SuccessFactors customers, align and interact during implementation with the partner or our own Professional Services to realizing great adoption on management, employee and HR level and renewal of the contract and make them our ambassadors

profile_positions.description:
As Global BWN we:
*Foster an inclusive atmosphere at SAP where women employees’ full potential can be realized.
*Drive and expand women’s leadership skills, career development opportunities, and business acumen.
*Strengthen and extend our professional network by building mutually beneficial relationships, both inside and outside of SAP
For onboarding and membership I focus on a variety of topics:
*advising new BWN chapters with regards to membership and onboarding through e.g. onb. sessions
*provide tools and resources for starting a new chapter
*maintain tracking mechanism for active chapters and maintain accurate chapter and member count
*work with regional leads to identify coaches/mentors to help new and inactive chapters
*identify "white space" areas where there is no BWN and create and execute plan to involve
*ensure new hires, early talent and acquisition companies are aware of BWN by internal alignment with stakeholders
*build BWN membership through constant promotion
*consistent communication and branding for the BWN brand
profile_positions.title: SAP BWN Global Director Onboarding and Membership

profile_positions.description:
In my role as Chapter Lead I'm leading the Business Women Network in the Netherlands. We are a team of 9 women who (besides their formal day job) empower women to embrace technology, inspire and support them to get the most out of their career at SAP. We organize events, work with role models, promote allyship, network with internal and external Employee Network Groups (like partners, customers).
In my role I work together with the regional BWN-team to exchange best practices, cross-collaborate and I'm in contact with the Global BWN team. In the Market Unit Netherlands I host a quarterly session with the management team, arrange executive sponsorship, manage budget & stakeholders and organize activities and events.
profile_positions.title: Chapter Lead Business Women Network SAP NL

profile_positions.description: Share my knowledge, skills and experiences on a certain topic/area of expertise and advice and guide mentees on the challenges they face/questions they have.
profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description:
In my role as certified coach I support colleagues in- and outside the Netherlands with challenges they face. It can be professional or personal challenges like career coaching, how to deal with work/life balance and development of skills. I truly believe that everybody has the ability to develop, change and unleash their potential. Especially by exploring positive experiences in the past were they felt energized, motivated and effective. It’s fantastic to see how coachees after a couple of sessions are able to change some of their behaviors or make choices to change their career.

I also act as mentor to new joiners in the HR area and am a buddy for new colleagues in the CEE area.
profile_positions.title: Certified Coach

profile_positions.description: In June 2013 we did a kick-off of the Business Women Network team for SAP NL. Since then I'm actively involved in organizing all kind of activities ranging from organizing sessions with inspiring speakers, arranging a mentorship program, bring your talent to work activity (kids-event), building relationships with external networks (IGNITE, VHTO, Women in Tech), Talent win activities, virtual tea-time sessions during pandemic.

profile_positions.description:
During one month working as a Project Consultant at Proyectar Sin Fronteras (PSF) to make an impact on people's lives together with 2 other SAP colleagues from Prague and India/US. We were part of a group of 12 colleagues from all over the world supporting 4 projects.
The aim of the organization is to create solutions to social, environmental and economic challenges, especially within vulnerable populations in Bogota, Colombia. They do this via:
* sale of organic market baskets from small producers
* construction of installations of edible gardens in businesses and homes, especially in Santa Rosa
* trainings & workshops about agriculture, nutrition and environment to low and high income schools
* a collective space for the development of spiritual, culture and entrepreneurial projects in low-
  income neighborhoods (f.e  support of teenage mums, computer lessons, breakdance lessons)
* Textile fabrication business with its own brand and a solidarity brand
* Micro-franchise of coffee bars

Blog: http://socialsabbaticalbogota2015.blogspot.com/
Video on Social Sabbatical (The SAP Social Sabbatical for Global Engagement- A Career Transforming Experience!: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B_kars6vwfQ
profile_positions.title: Social Sabbattical (SAP)- Project Consultant
